head.title: Finding the Best Is on the Last Page

hedline.hl1: Finding the Best Is on the Last Page

abstract.p: Donna D Lewis letter lauds Edmund Conti's recent essay on topical front-yard icons (S)

block.p: I have a hard and fast recycling rule: if I haven't gotten through the Sunday Times by Thursday, into the bin it goes. No haggling, no negotiating. It's Wednesday already and I had the wrenching breakfast choice of the Arts and Leisure section, which prepares me for grocery store run-into's, or the New Jersey section, which updates me on the rubble to renovation of cities I don't visit. Faced with a busy day, I choose New Jersey. It's shorter.

It's Wednesday already and I had the wrenching breakfast choice of the Arts and Leisure section, which prepares me for grocery store run-into's, or the New Jersey section, which updates me on the rubble to renovation of cities I don't visit. Faced with a busy day, I choose New Jersey. It's shorter.
Just as I rued and stewed over my choice (another week without Edmund Conti's American haiku) I found Mr. Conti's delightful essay on the very last page. Mai Non, yes! How about for April: cruelest?
I'm thinking it may be time to swap my front-yard flamingos for topical -- not tropical -- icons.
